pageContext.claim: “We have the worst libel laws anywhere in the world. They can say anything they want, and we can't sue them, because if you're famous, you can't sue. Figure that one out.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. Libel suits require a high burden of proof under the First Amendment, but that doesn't mean people can defame others at will. Moreover, these same libel laws have protected Trump, who often attacks critics with falsehoods and hyperbole.
